alert.note: Alert for Copiah; Franklin; Lawrence; Lincoln; Simpson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 14 at 7:41AM CST until December 14 at 9:45AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Copiah County in central Mississippi... Southwestern Simpson County in central Mississippi... Northwestern Lawrence County in south central Mississippi... Lincoln County in south central Mississippi... Eastern Franklin County in southwestern Mississippi... * Until 945 AM CST. * At 741 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Brookhaven, Hazlehurst, Wesson, Enterprise, Loyd Star, Vaughn, West Lincoln, Martinsville, Glancy, Caseyville, Bogue Chitto, Allen, Mccall Creek, Sontag, Center Point, Pleasant Hill, Oma, Little Springs, Rockport and Beauregard. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
